column1: This military leader of the [[Éothéod]] served under [[Lord of the Éothéod
He aided the [[Gondorians]] against the [[Wainriders]] in the summer of {{TA

During the battle, he rode to the rescue of a party of Éothéod as they retreated to­wards the [[Dead Marshes]]. A soldier died in his arms. After he searched his body he found out that the dead soldier was [[Faramir (son of Ondoher)

The Leader went to join [[Minohtar]] at the head of the [[North Road]] in [[Ithilien]].  Minohtar was preparing a message to be taken to the prince when he learned the news that the prince had been killed in battle.<ref>{{UT
The name of that leader is unknown. [[Christopher Tolkien]] says that the first part of his name is "Marh-" but the rest is illegible.
Marh- is a [[Gothic]] name element meaning "horse" (see also [[Marhari]], [[Marhwini]]).
